qas.question: In what year was CBS the only network to also have a record company?
What label did ABC sell in 1979?
What label did NBC sell in 1986?
By 1997, which network was the only "big three" to also have its own record company?
CBA sold its record division to whom in 1979?
RCA's parent company NBC was sold to whom ?
BMG was later known as what Ariola what?
In what year was RCA's parent company NBC sold to General Electric?

context: By <a0_0>1987<a0_0/>, <b4_0>CBS<b4_0/> was the only "big three" American TV network to have a co-owned record company. ABC had sold its record division to <a1_0><b5_0>MCA Records<b5_0/><a1_0/> in 1979, and in <b8_0>1986<b8_0/>, NBC's parent company <a2_0>RCA<a2_0/> was sold to <a3_0><b6_0>Ge<a3_0/>neral Electric<b6_0/>, who then sold off all other RCA units, including the record division (which was bought by Ariola <b7_0>Records<b7_0/>, later known as BMG).
